description: This popular street-food dish, called tteokbokki, is a garlicky, richly spiced dish of rice cakes bathed in red chile paste Tteokbokki (pronounced duck-bo-key) got its own festival, spinning off from the larger annual Seoul festival of rice cakes, or tteok.
title: Korean Rice Cakes With Red Chile Sauce
title_page: Korean Rice Cakes With Red Chile Sauce Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
This popular street-food dish, called tteokbokki, is a garlicky, richly spiced dish of rice cakes bathed in red chile paste. Tteokbokki (pronounced duck-bo-key) got its own festival, spinning off from the larger annual Seoul festival of rice cakes, or tteok.
Featured in: Culinary Diplomacy With A Side Of Kimchi.
